main event: A celestial object was sighted by a ship captain in the North Atlantic Ocean on July 29, 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed near the star Regulus and traveled towards the star Vega before going down to the horizon.
The object was visible for about 7 minutes.
The weather conditions were clear with a northwest wind and a barometer reading of 1006 mb.
The observer was interested in knowing what the object could have been.
The report was forwarded to the National Aerial Phenomena Agency by the U.S. Naval Oceanographic Office.
sighted object: a satellite-like or bright star-like object
